definition: sacrifice to drive away calamity/to dispel/to drive away/to remove
hematoma (internal blood clot)/extravasated blood (spilt into surrounding tissue)/contusion

sentences.english: The effects of wine fried Danshen in activating blood and eleminating stasis were studied.
sentences.chinese: 探讨酒炙对丹参活血祛瘀作用的影响。

sentences.english: It will take seven or eight days just to clear the blood and the swelling away.
sentences.chinese: 将花费七至八天的时间用来消肿祛瘀。

sentences.english: Strengthening spleen and kidney and improving circulation. Removing blood stasis to produce new.
sentences.chinese: 补脾益肾改善循环，祛瘀才可生新。

definition: to invigorate blood circulation and alleviate pain (idiom)
to relieve (cold, rheumatic pain etc)/lit. to dispel pathogenic wind (TCM)
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
to course the liver and rectify 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
conversant with the Confucian classics/to stimulate menstrual flow (TCM)
peach kernel, used in Chinese medicine
hematoma (internal blood clot)/extravasated blood (spilt into surrounding tissue)/contusion
